mqtt_remote package¶

Submodules¶

mqtt_remote.callbacks_local module¶

Local callback related functionality.

Examples

To get the local callback modules:

full_path_of_local_callbacks = Path(LOCAL_CALLBACK_DIR_FULL_PATH)
local_callbacks = local_callback_modules(full_path_of_local_callbacks)

To import the local callback modules manually:

full_path_of_local_callbacks = Path(LOCAL_CALLBACK_DIR_FULL_PATH)
local_callbacks = local_callback_modules(full_path_of_local_callbacks)
import_local_callback_modules(local_callbacks, LOCAL_CALLBACKS_DIR_NAME)

To import the local callback modules automatically:

auto_import_local_callback_modules()

mqtt_remote.callbacks_plugins module¶

Plugin related functionality

Examples

To return all top level modules in the current namespace:

all_top_level_module_names = names_of_all_top_level_modules()

To return the names of all modules that have the plugin prefix:

all_top_level_module_names = names_of_all_top_level_modules()
plugins = top_level_module_plugins(all_top_level_module_names, PLUGIN_PACKAGE_PREFIX)

To get a list of plugin module names in the format required for importlib.import_module()

all_top_level_module_names = names_of_all_top_level_modules()
plugins = top_level_module_plugins(all_top_level_module_names, PLUGIN_PACKAGE_PREFIX)
formatted_plugin_names = format_plugin_names_for_import(plugins)

To manually import the plugin modules:

all_top_level_module_names = names_of_all_top_level_modules()
plugins = top_level_module_plugins(all_top_level_module_names, PLUGIN_PACKAGE_PREFIX)
formatted_plugin_names = format_plugin_names_for_import(plugins)
import_plugin_modules(formatted_plugin_names)

To automatically import the plugin modules:

auto_import_plugins()

mqtt_remote.config module¶

Configuration related functionality

Example

To load a YAML file:

file_contents = load_yaml(yaml_file)

To obtain a completed configuration from the configuration file:

initial_config = load_yaml(YAML_CONFIG_FILE)
config_completer = ConfigCompleter(initial_config)
completed_config = config_completer.complete()

To obtain a completed configuration from a raw configuration:

raw_config = load_yaml(YAML_CONFIG_FILE)
completed_config = completed_config_from_raw_config(raw_config)

To obtain a completed configuration from the configuration file:

completed_config = completed_config_from_file(YAML_CONFIG_FILE)

mqtt_remote.message module¶

Message related functionality

Examples

To create a command message:

topic = 'a_topic'
payload = {"command": "print_something", "attributes": {"thing_to_print": "Spam"}}
qos = 0
retain = False

command_message = CommandMessage(topic, payload, qos, retain)

To create a Paho to command message convertor:

message_convertor = PahoToCommandMessageConvertor()

To create a converted message forwarder:

message_forwarder = ConvertedCommandMessageForwarder()

To create a callback caller:

callback_caller = CommandMessageCallbackCaller()

To setup the message forwarder:

message_convertor = PahoToCommandMessageConvertor()
message_forwarder = ConvertedCommandMessageForwarder()
callback_caller = CommandMessageCallbackCaller()

message_forwarder.message_convertor = message_convertor
message_forwarder.callback = callback_caller.callback_caller

To setup the callback_caller:

callback_caller.mqtt_publish = publish_function
callback_caller.config = completed_config

To automatically register CommandMessageCallback callbacks with the callback caller:

callback_caller.auto_add_command_message_callbacks()

To check if a payload message is valid:

is_valid = valid_payload_value(message, keys, required_value_type)

To log that a command message was of the wrong form:

log_wrong_command_message_form(callback_name, required_message_form)

Automatically adds callbacks that inherit from CommandMessageCallback to the registered callbacks

The callback classes that inherit from CommandMessageCallback must be present in the namespace in order for them to be automatically found, instantiated and added

mqtt_remote.message.log_wrong_command_message_form(callback_name, required_message_form)¶

mqtt_remote.message.valid_payload_value(message, keys, required_value_type)¶

Checks if a value for a particular payload key within a command message is valid

Checks two things

1.) whether the key is present

2.) whether the value associated with the key is of the expected type

Parameters

  • message (CommandMessage) – CommandMessage to check

  • keys (list) – A list of keys ordered from root to leaf where the leaf is the key, value pair to check e.g. ‘keys’ for message.payload[‘attributes’][‘lounge’][‘temperature’] would be: [‘attributes’, ‘lounge’, ‘temperature’]

  • required_value_type (type) – The expected type of the value corresponding to the key being checked

Returns

True: if the ‘key: value’ pair is valid, False: if the ‘key: value’ pair is invalid

Return type

bool

mqtt_remote.mqtt_client module¶

MQTT Client

Examples

To create a CallbackSet:

callback_set = CallbackSet()

To add a callback to a CallbackSet:

def example_cb(message):
    print(message)

callback_set.add(example_cb)

To remove a callback from a CallbackSet:

callback_set.remove(example_cb)

To create an MQTT client:

mqtt_software_client = mqtt_client.MQTTClient('user_name',
                                              'password',
                                              '192.168.1.123',
                                              1883,
                                              60,
                                              [("MyPC", 0)],
                                              "MyPC",
                                              True,
                                              "3.1.1": mqtt.MQTTv311,
                                              "tcp",
                                              True)

To initialise an MQTT client:

mqtt_software_client.initialise()

To start an MQTT client:

mqtt_software_client.start('blocking')

To stop an MQTT client:

mqtt_software_client.stop()

To use the MQTT client to publish an MQTT message:

mqtt_software_client.publish("my topic", "hello world", 0, False)

True: the broker will remove all information about this client when it disconnects. False: the client will be a durable client (subscription information and queued messages will be retained when the client disconnects).

__init__(broker_user_name, broker_password, broker_ip, broker_port, broker_keepalive, subscription_topics, mqtt_client_id, mqtt_clean_session, mqtt_protocol, mqtt_transport, log_client)¶

Constructor

Parameters

  • broker_user_name (str) – The user name required to access the MQTT broker

  • broker_password (str) – The password required to access the MQTT broker

  • broker_ip (str) – The IP address of the MQTT broker

  • broker_port (int) – The port for the MQTT broker

  • broker_keepalive (int) – The maximum time, in seconds, that the client will remain quiet without sending an MQTT packet to the broker to confirm it is still connected

  • subscription_topics (list[Tuple]) – [(<topic>, <qos>), (…)]: topic: the MQTT topic to subscribe to, qos: the desired Quality Of Service for topic

  • mqtt_client_id (str) – An identifier for the MQTT client

  • mqtt_clean_session (bool) – True: the broker will remove all information about this client when it disconnects. False: the client will be a durable client (subscription information and queued messages will be retained when the client disconnects).

  • mqtt_protocol (str) – the version of the MQTT protocol to use for this client (as allowed by paho.mqtt.client)

  • mqtt_transport (str) – MQTT network transport: “websockets” to send MQTT over WebSockets. “tcp” to use raw TCP.

  • log_client (bool) – True: allow the log messages from the underlying paho client to pass through and be logged by this client, False: do not allow the log messages from the underlying paho client to pass through and be logged by this client

initialise()¶

Gets the underlying MQTT client ready to start

publish(topic, message, qos, retain)¶

Requests that the client sends an MQTT message to the broker for publishing

Parameters

  • topic (str) – The topic of the MQTT message to publish

  • message (str) – The MQTT payload to publish

  • qos (int) – The required Quality Of Service for the MQTT message

  • retain (bool) – True: the message will be set as the “last known good” / retained message for the topic. False: the message will not be set as the “last known good” / retained message for the topic.

Raises

RuntimeError – if the client has not been initialised prior to using this method

start(loop_type)¶

Starts the client

Parameters

loop_type (str) – determines in which mode the client is run: ‘blocking’ or ‘non_blocking’

Raises

  • RuntimeError – if the client has not been initialised prior to using this method

  • ValueError – if an unacceptable loop_type is provided

stop()¶

Stops the client

mqtt_remote.remote module¶

Application entry point

Examples

To get the installation path of the app:

installed_path = installation_path()

To configure logging:

configure_logging(completed_config)

To load all local callbacks and plugin callbacks:

load_all_callbacks()

To setup the callback caller:

callback_caller = setup_callback_caller(callback_caller,
                                        publish_function,
                                        completed_config)

To setup the message forwarder:

message_forwarder = setup_message_forwarder(message_forwarder,
                                            callback_caller,
                                            message_convertor)

To create an unconfigured MQTT client:

mqtt_software_client = create_mqtt_software_client(completed_config)

To setup the MQTT client:

mqtt_software_client = setup_mqtt_software_client(mqtt_software_client,
                                                  completed_config)

To create a configured MQTT client:

mqtt_software_client = create_configured_mqtt_software_client(completed_config)

To stop the MQTT client in a controlled manner:

controlled_shutdown(mqtt_software_client)

To start the application manually:

start(mqtt_software_client)

To start the application automatically:

auto_start()
